content.description: Two parallel cracks running up this slabby boulder. A lot of variations to this climb but the preferred method for the grade is only utilizing the right finger crack. Left crack is fingers and hands at times, tends to be dirtier. You can also do a compression variation or fun Gaston moves.This route is also one of the better downclimb options here.This problem may go by a different name.
content.location: Scramble downstream away from the parking lots.

content.description: Fun hand jam, layback possibilities, and horizontal crack features. Easy hand jams or jugs with bomber feet. Start with your hands jammed, one toe jammed, and a smear. Work your way up. Starting lower with a layback, or any other sit start method, makes the route harder because this part of the problem is often wet or slimy.May go by a different name.
content.location: Just past the second row of cars down by the creek.

content.description: Start in the cave matched on a jug. Left foot on a rail right on the pedestal. Work out left from under the cave to the left following the lip. Using slopers and a heel hook keep going left until you can get left hand on big jug in middle of crack system. Get feet up and press it out. Super fun moves and some great holds.
content.location: This is kinda hard to find but it’s smack dab in the river of rocks below the road. It’s above Plum Run itself. I’ll include a map. It’s possible this will be unclimbable if the river is very high.

content.description: Low start with your hands high. Utilize the underclings created by the flake and work up towards a fun topout. Crux is similar to that of Horizontal Plaything at Safe Harbor South.
content.location: Back side of the largest boulder along the run.

content.description: High step and lay back this bubblegum-like crack feature. Get into good jugs and mantle the lip. Follow easy slab to the top!
content.location: On the back of the largest boulder in this area. From the road find the faint trail and follow to biggest rock. Walk around back and look for obvious crack.

content.description: The crux is getting into the wide crack without being forced off right. Little bit awkward at the start but easy moves thereafter. Start with some hand jams, smears or ledges and find some useful jugs along the way. This crack will eat you up. This problem may go by a different name.
content.location: Further along the creek away from the road and parking lots.

content.description: Sit start with the flake on the corner of the twin cracks boulder. Work left then up. Fun campusing opportunities.
content.location: Around the corner from the twin cracks climb.

content.description: A disconnected crack system up the side of this boulder. Well featured rock with cracks, pockets, and some bomber jugs at the top. Height can be a bit intimidating but the landing is good, as are the holds. Slabby start.
content.location: The biggest boulder before the creek turns to the field. Pretty much the biggest boulder on that side of the road. Visible from the road and lots.

content.description: Across from the main Devil's Den formation along the creek that runs under and around some boulders. Typically has less tourists. Can be quite muddy and a few problems are creek level dependent. Easy cracks, artes, and a few overhangs to be found.
